General.Name: Grupa Azoty SA
General.Description: Grupa Azoty S.A. manufactures and sells fertilizers, plastics, and other chemicals in Poland, Germany, South America, Asia, other European Union countries, and internationally. The company operates through Agro Fertilizers, Plastics, Chemicals, Energy, and Other Activities segments. It provides compound fertilizers, nitrogen fertilizers with sulfur content, nitrogen fertilizers, ammonia, technical grade and concentrated nitric acid, and industrial gases. The company also offers plastics, including caprolactam; PA6 natural engineering plastics; modified plastics based on PA6 and other engineering resins comprising PA66, PPC-polypropylene, PPH, PBT-polybutylene terephthalate; plastic products, such as PA pipes, PE pipes, and polyamide casings; and polypropylene. In addition, it provides chemicals comprising melamine, oxo alcohols, plasticizers, sulfur, titanium white, and iron sulfate, as well as solutions based on urea and ammonia; and manufactures and sells catalysts, such as iron-chromium catalyst, copper catalysts, and iron catalysts. Further, the company produces and sells electricity, heat, water, process and instrument air, and nitrogen for chemical units; and provides laboratory services, as well as engages in the leasing of real estate properties. The company was formerly known as Zaklady Azotowe w Tarnowie-Moscicach Spólka Akcyjna and changed its name to Grupa Azoty Spólka Akcyjna in April 2013. Grupa Azoty S.A. was incorporated in 2001 and is based in Tarnów, Poland.
